    Simulate from Cox MSM Model

    msm_samp.Rd

    Obtain samples from a specified Cox Marginal Structural Model using the frugal parameterization.

    msm_samp(
  n,
  dat = NULL,
  qtls = NULL,
  T,
  formulas,
  family,
  pars,
  link = NULL,
  method = "inversion",
  control = list()
)

coxSamp(n, T, formulas, family, pars, link = NULL, control = list())

cox_samp(n, T, formulas, family, pars, link = NULL, control = list())

    Arguments

    n

    number of samples

    dat

    optional data frame for plasmode simulation

    qtls

    associated quantiles from dat for plasmode simulation

    T

    number of time points

    formulas

    list of formulas to use

    family

    list of families to use

    pars

    list of parameter settings to use

    link

    link functions for GLM-like models

    method

    sampling method (defaults to "inversion")

    control

    list of control parameters

    Value

    An object of class survivl_dat containing the simulated data.

    Details

    Samples from a Marginal Structural Model specified by a frugal parameterization; that is, one must specify the marginal model (i.e. the dependence of the outcome on the treatments), the distribution of the covariates, observed confounders and treatments, and then a copula to join the distribution of the outcome to that of the confounders.

    Among the left-hand sides of outcome variables, the variable 'Cen' has a special meaning as censoring. This keyword can be changed to something else by using the argument censor in the control list.

    Functions

    • coxSamp(): old name

    • cox_samp(): old name

    Contents
